summary: The Latin alphabet, or Roman alphabet, started as the writing system for the Latin language in ancient Rome. Over time, it evolved into the script used for many modern languages. It has 26 letters, with some changes like the addition of 'J' and 'U' and the creation of 'W'. This alphabet is now used worldwide, in Europe, Africa, the Americas, and Oceania. The standard set of these letters is called the ISO basic Latin alphabet.
title: Latin alphabet
